alert.note: Alert for Carroll (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 9:14AM EST until December 20 at 3:00AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Gray ME has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Maine...New Hampshire... Saco River At Conway affecting Carroll, Oxford and Cumberland Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Saco River at Conway. * WHEN...From this afternoon to early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Widespread flooding occurs along the west bank of the Saco River near Moat Brook Road, cutting off access to some homes. Flood waters enter agricultural lands in eastern Conway and into Freyburg. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM EST Monday the stage was 6.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 14.5 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
